p: The obtained database collected information on demographics, score of the American Society of Anesthesiology (ASA), pre-operative clinical stage, neo-adjuvant chemotherapy or radiotherapy, patho-histological data, peri-operative mortality (defined as either in-hospital mortality or death within 30 days of surgery in case of earlier discharge), length of hospital stay and post-operative complications using the Clavien-Dindo classification. Survival data was last updated on the 30th of June 2017. Disease-free survival was defined as the time from the date of primary treatment (surgery) to the date of first recurrence, be it local, systemic or both if they had occurred 6 months apart. Overall survival was defined as the time from the date of the primary treatment to the date of death. Patients were divided into 2 groups according to the type of procedure, the LAR and the APER group.
